intro: Leonohebe subsimilis, commonly known as the slender leonohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. This species is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
